headline.main: RURAL ECONOMY.; Gleanings of Fact and Practice in Fruit Culture. THE APRICOT.

docs.lead_paragraph: GENERAL REMARKS.--This fruit is esteemed far more highly by the English than by us. In its wild state, the apricot is a small, round, pale, waxy, yellow fruit, rosy on one side, and of an agreeable subacid flavor.
docs.snippet: GENERAL REMARKS.--This fruit is esteemed far more highly by the English than by us. In its wild state, the apricot is a small, round, pale, waxy, yellow fruit, rosy on one side, and of an agreeable subacid flavor.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOWERY AND THIRD-AVENUE RAILROAD. A petition was presented in reference to the opening of the Bowery and Third-avenue Railroad. Mr. BEEKMAN presented a petition in relation to the opening of Sixth-avenue.
docs.snippet: BOWERY AND THIRD-AVENUE RAILROAD. A petition was presented in reference to the opening of the Bowery and Third-avenue Railroad. Mr. BEEKMAN presented a petition in relation to the opening of Sixth-avenue.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, the 9th instant, the proceedings were of no interest in either House of Parliament. On the 10th, in the Commons, Mr. DRUMMOND asked whether the Government had considered the effects of the reduced value of gold, and its consequences, and whether it was not advisable to appoint a Committee to inquire into the altered value of the standard.

docs.lead_paragraph: We give on another page of this morning's paper, a communication, from a party interested, in regard to our remarks the other day, on the Life and Health bill now before the Assembly.
docs.snippet: We give on another page of this morning's paper, a communication, from a party interested, in regard to our remarks the other day, on the Life and Health bill now before the Assembly.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Asia arrived at 7 o'clock last night from Liverpool, bringing news three days later. Cotton and Breadstuffs are reported dull; Money in great demand yet.
docs.snippet: The Asia arrived at 7 o'clock last night from Liverpool, bringing news three days later. Cotton and Breadstuffs are reported dull; Money in great demand yet.

headline.main: THE BOURBON QUESTION.; Letter from the Prince de Joinville. Further Evidence Sustaining the Claims of Eleazer Williams.

headline.main: Arrival of the Isabel at Charleston--Six Days Later from Havana--Serious Disturbances Among the Troops--Slaves Landed--British Steamer Devastation at Havana--Measures for the Suppression of the Slave Trade.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. mail steamship Isabel, with Havana and Keyport dates to the 22d inst., arrived at this port to-day. Mr. KING'S health was no better. It was rumored that serious disturbances has taken place among the troops at Santiago de Cuba, or some other port in the Eastern Department of the Island.
